intro: Halenia taruga-gasso, commonly known as the Japanese halenia, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four petals. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding a delicate touch of color to its natural habitat.
